TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 07-14-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James F. Perry, July 14, 1830. Hostility to Americans in Mexico subsiding. Orders various books. Is to be elected to the legislature.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 451-453

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, July 14, 1830. Hostility to Americans in Mexico subsiding. Orders various books. Is to be elected to the legislature.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*In addition to the memorandum I sent you in my letter of the other day, I wish you to get me copies of the constitutions of *location_mentioned*Columbia*/location_mentioned*, of*location_mentioned* Buenos Ayres*/location_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Chili*/location_mentioned*, of *location_mentioned*Peru*/location_mentioned*, and what is called the *location_mentioned*Bolivia*/location_mentioned*n Code or constitution given by *person_mentioned*Bolivar */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*upper Peru*/location_mentioned* or *location_mentioned*Bolivia*/location_mentioned*, they are all in Spanish— I think you can get them at some of the bookstores, or perhaps from some individual who has been to those *location_mentioned*countries*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*In place of the scarlet jacket which I wrote for get me a blue clothe vest to suit the surtout and not a scarlet one — bring me a good raisor or two.*/p*
*p*you must be particular if you come by *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*to have contracts with the *person_mentioned*servants */person_mentioned*or the *person_mentioned*officer */person_mentioned*at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*will interpose some difficulties. If you come by water contracts are also necessary.*/p*
*p*I hope you may get here by *date_mentioned n="12-01-1830">1 of Decr*/date_mentioned* for it is possible I may have to leave here in the *date_mentioned n="Winter - 1830">winter*/date_mentioned*, the mail of today brings me letters stating that I shall be voted for at *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*to represent *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*in the *person_mentioned*state Legislature, */person_mentioned*if so I shall be elected of course, for in this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned* I shall not loose a vote, and but few if any at *location_mentioned*Goliad */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*they have started me at *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*the whole thing originated with the *person_mentioned*native Mexican population*/person_mentioned* of that place and *location_mentioned*Goliad*/location_mentioned*— I had no idea, and no wish for such a thing I cordially detest politics in any *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and our affairs in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*have been so entangled by some one (and it is suspected by an *person_mentioned*american*/person_mentioned*) that I dread entering within their reach— True it is that the prejudices against *person_mentioned*north Americans*/person_mentioned* are subsiding in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, but still, there are some remnants of bitter feeling left among the uninformed who believed that *person_mentioned*Poinsett */person_mentioned*was the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* Government, and that all *person_mentioned*north Americans */person_mentioned*were connected with his intreagues— The situation will be an unpleasant, and perhaps a critical one, but an honest and prudent course has always carried me safely through many difficulties in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and I have faith that it will continue to do so.*/p*
*p*The election is next *date_mentioned n="08-xx-1830">month*/date_mentioned*— The *person_mentioned*Legislature */person_mentioned*meets *date_mentioned n="01-01-1831">1 of January*/date_mentioned*— there are two *person_mentioned*members */person_mentioned*only from all *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*: tho after this year we shall have several more owing to an increase of population, and the ratio is to be new moddled next session.*/p*
*p*The result of the election will be published after it is over— contrary to the custom in the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* but little is said about elections and there is but little electionering in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, a *location_mentioned*candidate */location_mentioned*who says any thing himself, to influence votes can be deprived of his seat— this has prevented open and public electionering—*/p*
*p*"Remember me to *person_mentioned*Mr Learning*/person_mentioned* and see about the *location_mentioned*Maps*/location_mentioned*— I perceive they are out, I want a number on rolers— they are for presents to *person_mentioned*Mexicans */person_mentioned*and of course I wish for the best— *person_mentioned*Tanner */person_mentioned*will realise more by that *location_mentioned*map*/location_mentioned*, than by any thing he ever published in his life and I rejoice that he will do so— tho I need some cash to pro- cure a few choice Spanish, and English books of a literary and historical character to try and improve my mind which needs it much, for during the ten years I have spent in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, but few books have come within my reach—*/p*
*p*farewell may heaven bless you and land you and *person_mentioned*sister */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*young one[s]*/person_mentioned* safe in the "*location_mentioned* wilds of Texas*/location_mentioned* "*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="07-14-1830">July 14 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*I am greatly in need of *person_mentioned*Waits */person_mentioned*State papers, published in *location_mentioned*Boston*/location_mentioned*. I had them in *location_mentioned*Missouri */location_mentioned*but lost them in *location_mentioned*Arkansas*/location_mentioned*— A number subscribed for them at the *location_mentioned*Mines */location_mentioned*and I think a set might be got there cheap.— In my other letter I wrote to you to get me a blue undress Military surtout with a standing collar trimmed with black silk cord—yellow bridle bits yellow spurs and yellow stirrups, these I need very much and a pair of boots*/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr James F. Perry*/person_mentioned* Care of *person_mentioned*Price and Morgan*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Philadelphia*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
